text: everyone who worked on [MutableArithmetics](<https://github.com/jump-dev/MutableArithmetics.jl>) for letting me formulate absolutely gargantuan MILP's with JuMP in just a couple of seconds.  Meanwhile people are doing this in python with PuLP and it's taking them literally hours

text: MA is definitely doing a hell of a lot.  I know this first hand... in the earlier days of JuMP, before MA existed, I frequently implemented much more "hackish" versions of these operations on my own to get the performance I needed.  Julia is great for doing this sort of thing, but I did not write a comprehensive set of operators for all types, I would just hack in the specific method I needed when I needed it
